Entry.1:
F & rain at night.

We arrive Home & get to bed at 2 am, we sit down to supper at 11.50 pm & at 12.5 am find that 13 sat down. S gets me alongside. We go Home through all back streets & nearly get lost. All in fancy dress & have a real Happy Time. Lilley, E & I go to Lyric Theatre, see good show. I am very emotional at Scotch songs. Marionettes grand especially the woman with long skirts who dances. Come down the short minute he steps.

Wrote auntie annie.
Entry.2:
F

We hear that Monkey is to leave us. E, W, H & I go down town via Funicular Car. They go to YMCA & I go round to flat. Only Miss Clarke at Home. We hear all about Cologne from RAMC & Cas of 29 Division. 

No white bread, no butter, no leather, all clothing etc of paper. Home Supper & sit & chat all night. Wait 30 min for Tram. Talk to pretty French girl. Have to walk up hill all the way.
Entry.3:
F & W

My day off. I go down to flat via long route. Have afternoon tea. Go to Nice Harrais & back to YMCA for Tea. Am bossed about & made to sit where I don’t want to sit. Meet all the Girls. Ellis & S/S Lilley come down & we watch rotten concert.

The "Ceramic" is in the Harbour. Receive letters from Lottie, Home & P.C’s from Os Merritt & Lily. Monkey has not left yet. Supper & bed early.
Entry.4:
W

Recd letter from M.R.L. Go to YMCA alone & see good concert by Crocks. Kissing, Les Holmes old song is a reminder of old days. Come Home tout Suite & write. Monkey goes away.

Wrote Dad & M.R.L.
Entry.5:
W

Go down Town & to flat with Medicine. Go around to YMCA, see Chappie & Sallie but only stop a few minutes. Go down Rue Paris twice & then Home by long route. Try to write but too interested in Tales of Old Times at 39 Gen.

Wrote Lily.
Entry.6:
F

Recd letter from W.H. Hughes. We fill in all papers but pending move to Bulford they are not signed. Little "Bo Peep" at Cinema afterwards. I have trouble to get a dog for show. It is a great treat & I fall in Love with Bo-Peep who is glorious.
Entry.7:
F Lovely Day

I have to return all gear to Q.M. & send Patients to H & I lines. I lose half my Bolsters & lots of gear ‘cos it is too much to do in one afternoon. I am ord S/M. write all night.

Wrote Lottie, OS, Jennie. Mum.
Entry.8:
F

Go down Town to see Dick Whittington & His Cat with Ellis & S/S Lilley. It is very long up to 11.15 pm. Very good in parts. I meet Natt, Roy’s Brother. He, with whom I was nearly drowned. There is lots of sentimental rubbish shewn & I am very scornful of it all. We have to walk all way Home via steps route.
Entry.9:
F

Go down town but get the cold shoulder from all so I return Home straight away & get by mess time to talk until bed-time. Have long argument about Burford system as compared with this system of running a Hospital.
Entry.10:
F

S/S Lilley & I go down town to YMCA. Band concert. We wait an Hour for the Pictures & then return Home without seeing any. It is very "cold & windy".
Entry.11:
F

Ellis & I go down to Base & meet Roy. We do nothing until after Tea & then change Breeches & Hat. We all go to Pictures but Ellis does not see it all out. Meet the Q.M. who was once a Manlyite. We have good run back to Graville & meet a very nice W.A.A.C. & nearly get overcarried. We walk up the Hill.
Entry.12:
F

Go down Town. Meet Bert Brian & Horniball. We go & have Photos taken & then to YMCA Service. I go to Gare with them & have a French Roll Sandwich. Come Home & write. Recd no letters. I am very emotional & lonely & tell MRL. Go. I work hard returning Gear.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.13:
F

Go down town with Jeff Claite. H’cut & shave with a Lady in other chair. Change 2F 1C. Go to YMCA & see Chappie. Only smile at Chappie. Meet James who has just escorted Chappie to dinner. Good Yankee Concert by 2 men & ladies from "Now there Revue". Man over the biggest wish. Girls are good impressionists. I see a Froggie & Girl leaning against a wall near St Advense Tram turning.
Entry.14:
F

Work all morning returning Boards etc. Am called a Burglar by Quarter Bloke. Bath in afternoon & doing nothing else. Recd parcel from Nette with socks, sugar & fruit. Wear socks over to Blighty. I have to warn draft for 8.30 in morning after returning from Town. I do a bit of shopping after YMCA band has finished & chat with Yankee Stelple Jack.
Entry.15:
F & W

We leave 39 at 9 am & embark on St Patrick. Sail after 1 pm. We have a good passage & anchor 7.30 pm. We occupy Nurses Quarters & I dine with Officers, waiter & all. I go on duty until 11 pm & see everyone comfortable. Sleep lovely & enjoy Brekkie bet on in the morning. I see 100’s of Chows boarding the Empress of Russia. All sorts of Itats. I am happy to leave France.
Entry.16:
F & W

We leave boat at 10 am & S’hampton at 1 am. Soup & my butter & cheese on Train. Arrive Tidworth & lorry to Pound House at 3 pm. I start work 10 minutes after I arrive. Go to bed with Supper at YWCA. Ellis has an awful Trip but we are on velvet all the Time. It is lovely to view the fields of all England again.
Entry.17:
F

Go to Bulford by Car & go to Dick’s Room all night. We yarn & sup & go to mess. Afterwards I play Billiards a bit yarn with all the old Boys. We have a lovely walk Home in the moonlight. Recd letter from Manly Predday.

Send telegram to Auntie.
Entry.18:
F

Lovely day, we got to Bulford by Car so to mess & Dick’s room. E goes to Gibbys with Tap. I go to YWCA & Post Office. So to meet Hilda & Corrie & get scaled. So back to Dance & Dance with Dick Dolly Moore who I squeez & also Dorrie Webster. We set out & walk home. I laugh at Billy & Ellis sliding on the frosty hill side.
Entry.19:
F & Rain at night.

We work hard & set out for Bulford about 3 pm, meet Car at sling & get a ride. Afternoon Tea & Tea to follow. Music billiards for Civies & WAACs. After Tea Dancing for which I do all the playing. We have supper & then the car brings us all Home in great style. I meet Tom Twentyman & most of the old Sergeants.
Entry.20:
W

Awful day so I get as wet as a hen chasing about everywhere. I do overtime at night helping Painter.

Go over to YWCA for Coffee etc. go to bed early after writing in New Mess quarters, meet Len Ray of Burwood & also corporal off Aquitania. Sent Books of Digger & Aussie Home. Wrote MRL Con & Mrs Edwards.
Entry.21:
W & F

We start the Mess & do real well. I meet Norm Gibson again. Use Nette’s sugar for Breakfast. I pack up for Bulford. Go over to mess for a while & then off to bed early as I am very tired.
Entry.22:
F

We set out by Car tont suite at 9.30 am for Bulford. Report & begin duties at once. Things in an awful mess. We set our room up & go up to Top’s room for a while. We break the stove & chimney falls on my bed & makes awful mess. We go to bed early thoroughly done up.
Entry.23:
F

Long busy worrying day. We straighten our room up & then the lights go out. We go to Tops room for an hour then I find Hurricane lamp & we get ready for bed after a lovely Hot bath. Our troubles never cease but we are set at last in a new room.
Entry.24:
F & ice

E & I go to Pictures & they are bon. Come Home for supper at Top’s flat & then off to bed later on. Recd 2 letters from Auntie Annie. I sleep in spring bed & rather don’t sleep. Dream of hurricanes & volcanoes etc on Esplanade.
Entry.25:
F & ice

We go to Dance but I am not in mood neither is Mifo. Moove some sit out & tell stories. I play for Schottische. Go to Top’s flat & talk until bed time. I sleep better in fact too well & can’t get up next morning.
Entry.26:
W

Tommy W & I go to Durrington & to church. I scale Miss M to go to church. Tea & supper at YMCA Florrie & I meet in the aisle & she is very conscious of her wrong doings. I hurry Home with Allam Waterman & Tom & write letter in triplicate. Wrote MRL Home & Mary.
Entry.27:
W & Little Snow

Ring from Hilda. Recd letter from France from Connie. We straighten out some Cards & D Sheets. I go to meet S & R at night & then come back to flat for talk with Dick & Reg. we play Bridge until a late hour.
Entry.28: I meet H.A.H. & we go to see the "Kiss Cure" which is tres bon. I go down to YWCA at 8.45 to take Dick & Reg round at the Dance but only have 2 dances myself. I sit & talk to Dolly quite a lot & nearly ask to go for a walk.
Entry.29:
F & ice

Recd letter from MRL 
bad one
. I did not sleep last night for thinking & all the pretty ones could not make me forget 
Her
. recd letter from Hilda, Marion Edwards. I am dopey & sit by fire talking to A until 8.30 & then go to bed. E goes to Pictures. I receive my kit bag from Salisbury.
Entry.30:
F & ice

I work hard all day & rush up to Pictures at night. Come Home to W.O’s flat & chat until late. Recd letter from MRL good one.
Entry.31:
F & ice

The Stunt comes off & the supper, dancing & games are tres bon. Recd running shoes from George. I am very quite at show & cannot get to sleep at night for thinking of I.O.M.
Entry.32:
F & ice

Go down to YWCA to dance but do very little. Come Home take 2 WAAC’s Home. Dance mostly with Alice who is very nice dancer. Came Home & read until Ellis comes Home. Dicky & Dicky go Home for first time.
Entry.33:
F & ice

I rush off to P. House in new ambulance & walk from cross roads. Meet Aubrey Hickson & go to No 2 for Tea play Bridge until car arrives. Hurry down to YWCA dirty unshaven. Stay until Supper time & rush home to shave & write. Music & singing very good & 40 miles & home from P. House.

Wrote MRL
Entry.34:
F

E. goes to C.O. & has a long yarn about ourselves. I stay on office & room for while others go up to mess for dancing lesson. We muck up generally, & Dick gets a bang on the forehead. I take another fellows girl Home while he looks on. Nuryance & long yarn in the flat on my return.
Entry.35:
F & W

Go to Dance & have a low time. We have supper all to-gether & New Zealander invites himself in game to invite Him out. I butt in & take Dolly Home. She is very nice & invites me down next week. I get pushed by Judy, the ‘orrid tabby that I don’t like.
Entry.36:
W & Snow all morning.

Go to B’ford in motor with Fitz Hill. Buy dinner rice cakes at Ashornes, sugar etc supplied. Go to close stay till 7 pm. Go to No 13 & have nice musical evening. Miss the Ball but not Army. Have a bed mate but don’t see Him. Marion is engaged. I take Winnie Home & get roused on for being late.

Recd letter from Auntie Annie.
Entry.37:
F & ice

I arise at 6.30 am & breakfast. Catch 7.50 train to B’mouth & arrive at Downton, wait until 9 pm & then walk until picked up by an ASC wagon for 3 miles. Arr at Sarum & visit Winnie & Cis. Buy shoes for Dick & get to Sarum Pub by motor 4 a pint & walk back for dinner. Chat with Morris Gow & set out at 3 for Home. Catch Red X Amb to Ford & YMCA Car to B’ford arr 4.15 pm. Go to Pictures with T. D. R. F. & I see Hindle Wakes.
Entry.38:
F & ice

We conut beds again & I tidy up down in room.

We are all in a very gay mood especially when thinking about "
Old Guard
" we go up to the Flat & yarn & chat & have one or two hands at Bridge

Mote MRC & Home
Entry.39:
F & ice

We both go down to Dance & I have a good time. I scale Taney for the Maxima but fix things up. We make arrangements about a towel exchange. I am improving on my dancing & reverse rather better. I hop in to go Home with & M
Entry.40:
F & ice

Work hard all day, go up for Tea to see Doris & other W.A.A.C. for Tea. I go down to Y.M.C.A. a bit late & have to sit with Dick & others until 8 pm & then I go to sit with Q. M. We have a confidential chat & part good chums at the out of Bounds notice. Music good & enjoy myself.
Entry.41:
F & ice

We stay in until 7.30 & then go up for bath & play cards with Dick & Reg until late. I sleep in pyjamas first time since leaving Bulford. We have supper at the Flat.

11February, Tuesday

F & ice

I go to Sarum by 2 pm Train. Do shopping & go to No 13 after 3 vain attempts. Me & Albert & Miss Farris got to Dance. Ian very lively & entertain quite a lot. All Brummy dancers but I have a good time although I am sick. I play, dance, start games, wait & clean up cups etc at Dance.

12February, Wednesday

F & ice

I arise at 7.30 in the attic. Brekkie & catch 8.50 train to Bulford, met an N.A.C.B. Civi B- on Train. Arr Camp 10 am & recd letter fromM.R.L. E & I go to see "The Happy Day" Musical Comedy by S Hills – Tresbon. Im very sick, we see WWoody at the Theatre & Dicky’s Two on the Corner.
Entry.42:
F & ice

Recd letter from Jess, Mother & Doris. I am very sick but get all my work square at last. E. gets ready for London & I get my issue of Clothes. I write my Diary up & pack up my dirty togs for the wash. I am very tired waiting for a shave to go to bed.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.43:
Dull & Showery

Walk miles looking for a sit down like a Gippo with his Water-Bottle. I sit in office write. Recd letters from Esme & Maisie Hudson. Billiard Table mended. We have the riot by M.O.’s & C.O. over Diet. We all come a gutzer. I have a row with Registrars.

Wrote M.R.L., Auntie Annie & Jennie.
Entry.44:
F & Dull. Rain 5 pm.

We admit 
100 Patients
. I wash Hankeys & clean up room. No musician & I play all Dances. I am lonely ‘cos Dick is absent. I walk Home with Doris & Fassy & Stupe. R.A.F.’s play Billiards in Mess. I go to Dick’s flat & write. Nice warm day which is quite a change.

Wrote Mum & Nette.
Entry.45:
W. Very Rainy

Get my work absolutely square. Go to Y.M.C.A. & go straight up to D.M. I witness Pictures of D.A.M. on the Beach in Costume & Pictures of Doris. I am very dull & dopey. I speak behind fellows Backs. Dicky T’s is very exuberant & plays up generally.

Siddie comes Home at 11 pm.
Entry.46:
W.

Sgts mess meeting which is attended by C.O. Write by Mess Fire & go down to Dick’s flat to Play Cards.

Got some at 9 pm

Wrote M.R.L., Mrs Clarke
Entry.47:
F & W

Go to Dance. Dawn does not turn up I dance mostly with Dick who has improved considerably. I cllect money from Musician. I tell Alex & Dicky & Lance supper with us. Go home to flat sit by fire until E & Reg comes Home from Supper in mess.

Send Anzac Bullet to Aunt Annie.
Entry.48:
W.

Recd 10 letters from Home & Nette, Laura, Lottie, Maimie Caster, Dulce & M.R.L. We go to Pictures. See the "Daughter of the Gods". Grand Picture with good Lady Swimmers. Home to Supper, Billiards & Bed.

Wrote M.R.L., Esme, Jessie.
Entry.49:
W.

I go to Sarum, visit Close. Go shopping & help to fix Elsie’s skirt. Connie has chicken-pock. We laugh & play. I go to No 13 & amuse all generally. We dance & sing & laugh. I go Home with Nurse Win. Go to bed with Mr Edwards. Percy is Home & discharged.

I am reckoned a bad un by all ‘cos I don’t care where I sleep.
Entry.50:
W.

Arrive Home at 10 am after lovely Brekkie. Siddie got away. I go to flat & write while Dick & Reg go to see Venereal Picture, the villain & seducer of which is a Harry Nicholls. I am very sick & dopey & go to bed at 9 pm.

Wrote to Maisie Hudson & Doris & R.C. Comm.
Entry.51:
W.

We are inoculated on the breast & Capt Beale as rough as a . I go to Dance but am very crook I do not dance very much & come Home early & go straight to bed. I think of Ellis all day as to his whereabouts. I clean up room & generally tidy up.
Entry.52:
F.

Dick & I go walk around Bulford. Meet Woody & Dicky but do not linger. I worry R & D in Flat. I take washin! I nearly buy a fight over ill-treating a dog. I go to Y.W.C.A. & we play up generally especially with Dick. I come Home alone go to bed but cannot sleep until a very late hour. Thomas comes over & is awful drunk. He nearly makes me with the fumes.
Entry.53:
F.

I go walk around block then back to mess. I am in a very bad skin & tell Slogger Jones at the mol what I think about the Place. I play Billiards & go to bed about 9 pm.
Entry.54:
F.

Neary 300 admissions. I go to bed at 2 pm but have to get up again. Carry on until 7 pm & then go to bed. Can’t go to Dance too sick. We discharge 130 men also.

We are a mess ‘cos we don’t know where all the Patients have been put.

Wrote Marion Edmonds.
Entry.55:
F.

Very ill. Go to bed at 6 pm.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.56:
F.

Very sick go to bed at 7 pm. Wash Tunic Neck etc.
Entry.57:
F.

Lovely Day. I go to meeting Place & meet Jack the N.Z. pianist & L/C Nuttell from Dampreis show. Friend of Maud Hughes. We all get scaled & I come back to Mess & talk to Nuttell & go through wards.

Recd letter from M.R.L.

I dream about all Skeletons.
Entry.58:
F.

I am bit better & get washing & go to Dance. See Alice & we have chat about scaling one another I am very lively & play up considerably.

Recd letter from Jennie.
Entry.59:
F. Glorious Day

Hop men in mess. I alone get 4 Girls to play Snooker in front of mob. L/Cpl Nuttell sings bonza. We sit with Dot M. M. also at Tea. I slow Dick’s "Photos" & my own. N. Z goes at 7 pm. I go Home with Dane. Also have some fun with another Dolly. We all get presents & I get a pin cushion but sister gets a Bondoir Cap.
Entry.60:
F. Nice Day

We are again inoculated by Dick Top. Recd letters from M.R.L. & Aunt Annie. I go to Y.W.C.A. & they have no musician & I play all night with some measure of success. I am scaled for supper & promenade. 

Wrote to M.R.L.
Entry.61:
F & W

I go to Y.W.C.A. Dance & play an extra which is well received.

I dance Canadian Barn Dance & Brooklyn Schottische. I chat all about Plymouth to the Devon Lass & have supper with the N.Z. Sergts. Kilties (N.Z.’s) are in abundance.

Wrote Mum.
Entry.62:
W.

I go to pictures which are rotten. The two Dicks are there & I go to supper at Y.W.C.A.’s canteen après. I am unable to get Boots or Breeches.
Entry.63:
F.

Esme P. (20 yrs)

E. comes home & Dick packs up for going away. I learn of New W.O.’s but I am not eligible. We talk about Trade & other things. I do not send Photo away. I do some codging. We find a Batman. We are both up to see J.M.Y.’s.
Entry.64:
W.

I write several letters to M & Tweam en up eventually get one away & go to for dance & get scaled them go to Y.W.C.A. until 10.45. Ellis thinks I have gone astray when I don’t come home. We are all dopey & sick & I am very very much longing for Isle of Man & can’t sleep.

Dick Top goes away.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.65:
F.

G.O.C. makes rounds accompanied by very much Belying. I go to Y.W.C.A. & play for Dance all night. It is a very nice evening. I am feeling off & cannot get to sleep thinking about M.O.I.

Wrote Con & Marion.
Entry.66:
W.

I get my Breeches from the Tailor. I pack up for I.O.M. . I go to Y.W.C.A. & sit alone all night, reading music. Go home & straight to Bed. I wait on the corner for Nothing.

Wrote Nette, Dad, Mum.
Entry.67:
F.

I pack up for Isle of Man. Travel to Salisbury with Slade. I visit Cis & the Close. Good trip to London. Tea at A.B.C. in L’pool & go to Landing Stage. No boat & I walk around nearly get into a Court case because of a coquettish Miss who does not want to be kissed. I have to go to Y.M.C.A. & can’t find my bed. I go to sleep on Top bunk & hang my gear up like the presents that Santa Claus hangs.
Entry.68:
F.

I walk all around Town & Breakfast twice. Go down onboard & get straight to bed. Calm trip & arrived 4.45 pm by Douglas. Chat with N.Z. Arrive Milling Bridge & get ride to St Judes. I expect to meet Auntie & Marie & sure enough I meet them half way to St Judes. I am happy to be Home & although I had an awful feeling of sea sickness before going on boat, I fare very well.
Entry.69:
F.

We sit up until 1 am talking about Everything & all. We go to Ramsey & buy some things & I hurry M. Home. It is just lovely this day to be HOME.
Entry.70:
F.

Ellis hears of his acceptance of Early Repatriation form. Auntie, M & I go for ride to old Ballaugh Church & the Sun Dial. We come Home for Music & we stay in front room all night.
Entry.71:
F.

We go to Beach for a walk. Meet Uncle & Pig Trough on way home. I learn more about my Fate & I tin coiffeur. Play Rummy & other games in Kitchen. Supper at a late Home.
Entry.72:
F.

We go to Ramsey & Pictures & see the Deemster. I get puzzled in the Darkness. Tea at Cingalee & Home via Lezayre road. We are both very tired. I turn hair-dresser & I am made very happy. We top up til near 12 & are so sleeply.
Entry.73:
Dull

I write all morning. M & I go ride to Sulby Glen Port & Claddagh where we were caught once before in the rain. It rains again but we do not get wet. After Tea we sit by the Fire & read until bed time. Inhes Poems accepted.

Wrote Mum, Miss Peck, Miss Daye, Dulce, Lottie, Jessie, Laura.
Entry.74:
F.

I fly off to Ramsey via Sulby Glen. I do some shopping & visit Mont & Mrs Sayle who lived at Peel whose friend & cousin is Mrs Davies of Australian Paper Comp. Sydney. I have hard ride Home against wind. We sit by fire & I write & then we go to post. Tea & Rummy until bed-time. Recd letter from Ellis about His return & I send wire to go.

Wrote Ellis
Entry.75:
W.

We have music & cards in the front Room. We are all very happy & don’t want to go to bed. Ian H. Dring & make Supper. Another night until ‘heart am.
Entry.76:
W.

We read about the Soldier Pacts. We have dinner very late & M & I play cards until tea. More cards after tea but I only score. A & M do not K---- & poor M is very lachrymose at night.
Entry.77: W. we stop in & have music, singing & play cards all night. In afternoon we go for walk to P.O. & both are very silent. We have further chat on the things & on Botany. In evening M sings & plays quite a lot. I try to turn over music & sing but am not required so I sit down & do nothing. We play Rummy late & I easily run both the V & M out & we go upstairs together.
Entry.78:
Snow & F.

We go to Bridge & to Douglas. We ride through the snow storm & have 40 minutes wait. Tea at Calm Café & we are taken for honeymooners everywhere, we go to Gran’s by Broadway & have tea. I go to Mrs Grundys. We have nice chat. We buy cakes etc. nice ride home in Train warm & comfy although we are tired. We walk home from Bridge in the Dark.
Entry.79:
F.

We go to look for Venus but we can’t fix the telescope only see bright lights.

We go to Ramsey & to Pictures. See a Lone drama. Tea at Angalie go shopping & pay debts. Then we go to Mr & Mrs Gibsons. Home by Lezarpe Road meal nice & his bit & chatty all the way. I rush to Glen & meet M at P.O. We walk from the Bridge home & I relate incidents of my own Home life. Supper & cards until bed-time & we go to Room together & I see N.C.L.
Entry.80:
F. Lovely Day.

M & I sit by fire & talk etc. we are both very lively & happy especially at Tea. We sit & yarn by the fire at night & I am very tired. We have music & song & all go to bed at 11 pm. We look over spare stuff in my room. Auntie gives me a ring, also one for Ellis. I engage myself to be faithful for ever & .

I pack my bag & give M my old Pocket Book.
Entry.81:
F & Cold.

Wake at 4 up at 4.45. Brekkie & on a lovely morning & M comes to train with me & gives me a little knife in a Kapoake which is so delightfully shyly given. Meet Lt Gordon R.N. Fitzers on boat. Tymewald does good time catch 2pm Train. Sent P.C. from L’pool. Talk with Canadian Civi, & 14 F.A. Diggers. Tea at N.S. Club & catch 8.15 am Bulford 12 midnight. Sent P.C. to Dad. Awful journey. All rubbish on bed on return & I am too tired to make my bed properly. Recd letters from Marion, C, Ernie, Lottie, Marie Carter, Ida, Marg. Home (6) Dave, Bertha, Dulce.

Wrote Aunt Annie, M.R.L. Dad.
Entry.82:
F & Cold

I do no work at all but after tea we play cards & then E. comes down & packs his Bags. I go to bed at 8 pm very weary & tired. I begin my studies.

Wrote Co. Raffan & M.R.L.
Entry.83:
F. Lovely Day

I referee Hockey Match. Ellis goes away by 2 pm Train. I go to English Class & then to office to write & study, get to bed at lights out.

Wrote Home to dad.
Entry.84:
F. but very windy. End of Period.

I go to B-Keeping Class & English Literature Class.

Wrote Ida Dean, Dulce, Bert, Esme, Lottie & Bert Cocks.

Wrote M.R.L. & sent Books.
Entry.85:
F. but snow at intervals

Recd letter from Ellis.

I go to W.A.A.C.’s Dance in Sgts Mess. I play & dance & we have chocs, wine trifle & fruit salad. At midnight it is snowing hard EW & I are left to carry on alone.

Have bath & clean up after dinner.

29 March, Saturday

F. 6" covering of snow & much snow-balling in consequence.

Recd letter from Ellis & Miss Scroggins. Promotions come out as
Entry.86:
Sit & write until 8.30 pm & then go to bed. D. & D. come down at 9.30 while I am in bed & jam until lights out.

Wrote M/R.L.

Sent Mag to M.R.L. & S. Mail & A.B. to Auntie. Wrote Ellis & Miss Scroggins.
Entry.87:
F. Some snow storms.

Recd letter from M.R.L. (L/L). Over 130 admiss, & I work until 4 pm. Wrote until 6.15 & D & Lord & I walk all around & to Bulford. Meet Cpl Niuttall & we have supper at Garmain Canteen & listen to Mechanical Music. Walk around to Sling Y.M.C.A. Home & sit by fire until 10.30. Have long talks about the good old times.

Sent Dane’s letter & Blighty to Auntie.
Entry.88:
F. but tries to snow.

I go to English Class & am at Dance 7 pm. I play until 9. I get astray in Tango. Come Home & write 4 pages & post letters at 10 pm 30. An awful L – letter. Bill Trouter comes down to sleep & snores. D. & D. go back to London. Matt comes over.

Recd letter from Miss Scroggins & Ellis also wire. Lights out starts at 10.30 pm.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.89:
F. Frosty Lovely Day

Recd P.C. from Doris. I go to Sarum & meet Ellis. Go to No 13 others back to Town. I dine at Osmonds & Matt’s Girl tells me that she looked after me not for Matt’s sake. We shop & go back for Tea & Music. E. & I go to see Winnie & she does not mind a bit. We talk business etc. I see Ellis off & Marion & I go round Mill Walk also see Floss Home. They all tease me about I DM. I have nice bed & dream of back at D.J.’s & also M. sawing wood all over Summer Hill yard. She is Tres affect.

Sent coins to M.R.L.
Entry.90:
F.

I play Hockey. The civs & we 5 play the Tommies & W.A.A.C.’s. It is a game of rough play & squeaking all the time by the Tommies. Score 3 all. I come Home write & go to mess to read until 10 pm. Read in class room for an hour. The moon has a black appearance as if it were an eclipse.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.91:
F.

French draft in again. C.O. blows me up about Extension Report. Go to English & Book-Keeping Class & come down to write letters.

Afterwards, I go to bed at 10 pm & do all night about W. at S. Hill. I am then fatigue.

Wrote Miss Scroggins, Dad & Auntie Annie. Sent Brooches & Coins to Auntie.
Entry.92:
F. & Hot

Go shopping & to take my washing. Go to Dickens Lecture & is very good. Meet Cal Slater, come back to office & write & study. Do some English later on.

Wrote M.R.L. & Mais. Carter.
Entry.93:
F.

Go & play Hockey. Bonnie game I score 2 & miss 6 goals. Bath & go to Dance. Play & dance with some girls whom I have never danced with. I am very dopey especially between 8.45 pm & 10 pm.
Entry.94:
F.

Recd P.C. from Ellis. I go to Hop over & get annoyed over Snooker. Tea with Doris & Dick’s (2). Go for promenade after & meet Dick 3 times. Painful walk to B’ford Bridge & return to Supper & snooker.

Very tame affair all through & see D.O.R.A. again.
Entry.95:
F.

I go the classes other to dance. I play for 3 & dance 3 & see Miss Dick home & go home to bed very crook. I read awhile until Bill comes home.

Lovely hot day.

Wrote Ellis & M.R.L.
Entry.96:
F.

I go to Sarum & meet Ellis, we talk & sup at Osmonds. I change hats & see him off. Send wire to I.O.M. & Glasgow. I go to the Close & also No 13 where I stay. I am very early & entertain everyone all night with funny experiences.

Recd P.C. from Ellis. I dream about Bun, S. of Arts & falling off pile of boxes also M. will go to hit with me inspite of all ‘cos it is all night.
Entry.97:
F with a shower or two.

Catch 8.45 train to B’ford. Recd wire from I.O.M. Recd letter from Mrs Grundy. Referee Hockey Match & chat with Cor & get Photos taken. Class & write. Tea at a Med. Learn of probable march out to Park House. Lovely night & Venus shines brightly.

Write Capt Collister, Mrs Grundy, M.R.L.
Entry.98:
W.

Recd letter from M. I go for a walk & then go down to my room to lie down. I am supposed to march out but I don’t. I go to classes & try to write at 9 pm but I make an awful mess of the letter. Get to bed very sick & very weary at 10.30 pm.

Write Home, Marion Clarke, Marg, M.R.L.

11 April, Friday

Dull

Recd P.C. from Ellis. Left Glasgow on
Entry.99:
I pack up my bags I am supposed to be on Orderly Room & I go for a walk up Tin-Town. Ask F to Dance. Send Parcel & paper to Auntie & Marie. I go down to room & write, read & talk with Mac & Joe.

I d. that I find all the jewels & the Diamond on the railway line at bottom of Platform at Strathfield.

Sent Parcels & Paper to Aunt Annie.
Entry.100:
F.

I scrounge around wards but get nothing.

I go to Dance at night & I am real lively. Play & dance & say Goodbye to several old Friends. I go down & talk about Coast Hospital for an hour with Mac.
Entry.101:
April Showers & windy.

I pack up & get bus tat 11 am for Park House. Arrive on good order & condition. After dinner I go to Cholderton with Ern & another poacher. It rains like the deuce. I make a hit with my Red Cross Badge with some V.A.D.’s from the V.D. Hospital for W.A.A.C.’s. Come home for tea & write all night. Recd letter from Jennie with note from Mamie Jeffs on back.

Wtote M.R.L , Home, D.J’s.
Entry.102:
W & Windy 

Dreadful night of wind & rain. Recd letter & films from Ellis. Go down Shipton for walk. It is flooded. We have a drink at the Boot Inn. I see Capt Orr. Read all afternoon & evening.

Wrote Jennie, Roy & Dick.
Entry.103:
F but Windy.

I make my first inspection. Pay Parade. Do some tailoring & read & talk all night in Orderly Room.

Wrote to D.J’s & Davey Lord. Coins to M.R.L. & letter.

16 April, Wednesday

W & Windy.

Go to B’ford & fix up a lot of matters. Recd letters from D.J’s, M.R.L. & Auntie & P.C. from Ellis stating that he was sailing on the 13th to send cough dope to Margaret. M.C. Sent Parcel to Dick Tappin. Hear of Percy Bliss.

Wrote D.J’s, Home, M.R.L., Aunt Annie.

17 April, Thursday

F & W

Recd letter from Miss Scroggins. Have argument with Mc & Gunboat. Catch a fellow with uniform & do some police work, stay in O.R. alone all night, get several rings on the Phone. I chat away to all of ‘em. I read all night up to 9.15 pm. D. of having fortune told by diamond in ring. I shall be very happy on
Entry.104:
& good fortune stares me in face.

Wrote A.B.P.O. & Miss Scroggins.
Entry.105:
F. & Hot

W. Hanshan, Billy Knowles & I go walk to S Kimpton & Fifefields. We go rabbiting also. Have tea under apple tree to music by W.R.A.F.’s. Visit Old Kimpton Church. 13th century brass inlaid work,
Entry.106: century windows. Monks spy holes. Recd letter D.J’s & Margaret Millard. Very hot day & we sweat fearfully. I do nothing all day.
Entry.107:
F & Hot

Meet Hassells & Les Luker also Len O’Brien. Meet Bill Allinors. I go to Bulford & meet the boys in Mess. It is a lovely hot sultry day & we cut out the fire. We all go to Boozer & celebrate, but I have a row & buzz off. I am very put out but eventually go to bed easy in my mind.

I see H. Hey & M. taking off. C.H.H. has Sheperds Plain & M.C.R.
Entry.108:
F but windy.

I go to Tidworth all morning with a victim of sand-bagging. E.T. is drunk horrible. Recd letter from Jennie. I go to T’worth Delhi after Tea with a Patient. It is a lovely ride in the cool of the evening.

Wrote Mum, Mr Edmonds, Con, Marg, M. McKinnon, Aunt Annie.
Entry.109:
F. Lovely Day.

Everyone A.W.L. we carry on OK. C.O. arrives unexpectedly & there is a H--- of a scatter to find anyone. All on booze again. I set out for T’worth alone & buy Red Lamp. Home to read bath & to bed. I am thinking by day & dreaming by night. All the time. The boys get rabbits & the game keepers nearly get them.
Entry.110:
F.

I go to Amesbury & Bulford on bike, forget everything. Back for Tea, get medicine but no oil. Senator Pearce makes an inspection of Irrigation Hut but only on the outside. Recd letter from Jennie.

Wrote Auntie Annie & Miss Jeffs.
Entry.111:
F.

Livo & I go to village for walk. We develop photos & make a mess of them by fogging the lot.

I receive Parcel & note from M.R.L. I am anxious to write, I sit up till mid-night writing. I am continuously interrupted & I write all the things I did not want to write.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.112:
F.

Recd letters from Dad, Laura, Nettie, Marion C. I go to B’ford & arrive back at 3 pm. Pack up for dear life. Go down to village to get washing. Recd letter from Mum. Rack up all things & get ready.

Sent Wire to auntie.

Sent parcels to Auntie, Uncle, Marg McKinnon, wrote Dave Lord, Dick, Jennie.
Entry.113:
F.

We march out at 9 am. I take the party to Bulford. I see Florrie & take bag to Hobdens. We catch 12.27 & I go to Mrs Edmonds & meet Marion’s Bloke. We arrive at Front. I meet dozens of LH acquaintances. Billy & Les Nettleton. I go to No 13 Hut. I go to Pictures & all a man pestering a girl to get married & she wishes him dead. I am quite happy until then.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.114:
F.

Walk to P.O. to post letter.

I go to Y.M.C.A. We play Billiards. I play for Bucks dance & it is OK.
Entry.115:
W & Snow

I go to church & the parson talks at me & tells me to get an idea. We all sir around fire all day & I sort my bags over again. I play cards & go to bed early.

We get no dinner.
Entry.116:
F.

I go to Bulford for Teeth. Tea at mess. Go to Sarum & spend Home at No 13. I run all the way to train have to wait 30 minutes. Recd letters from Dick, Doris & Dad.
Entry.117:
F.

I rush around & get pass. Miss early train & catch 8.40 to Sarum arr London 11.35. Miss 11.45, catch 2.30 & go
Entry.118:
class & cold to Brum, arr 5.30 Brum. Break at Y.M.C.A. go around town in miserable rain, we have several feeds at full buffet.

Pay Parade. I dine up at Dinton on eggs & bacon. I am mess orderly & have cold bath.
Entry.119:
W & Fine

Leave Brum at 7.15 am & just have time for sandwiches before catching boat. I go right down below on the Fenella. Very calm. I come up on deck in Hour & ½ out. Catch 5.40 pm arr 7.10 & 7.50 in me on Drive. Very happy & nice. I am ravenous & we are all very merry together.

I share in train & use Pippins coat for towel. Travel with Tommy & L’pool Sailor.
Entry.120:
F.

I am up times & very hungry. I make a hard confession quite easily. M & I go for a walk. We clamber over the hedge & have to get over the water ditch. We sit by the fire & talk all evening. I do ironing.
Entry.121:
F.

Hot shower in afternoon. I get up early & light fire etc. I print P.Cto M. do ironing & Auntie & I go for a walk all around by back road. We get caught in the rains. I sit by the fire & write. I have my nails manicured & thank manicurist.

Wrote Dick & D. Op
Entry.122:
F & Showery

I take Marie to Ramsay. We go to Picture & shopping. I lose her & get wind up about coming home alone. Arrive home & very tired. I am off my tucker & quiet. All others play cards while I watch puzzle. We go to bed & I get my face painted & tucked in. a lovely good night by -----, while all others look for Venus & the moon.
Entry.123:
F.

We work at Puzzle especially Marie. I go up to make my bed & M. comes to fix my blind. In afternoon M. sews while I puzzle.

We all sit & try puzzle at night. I on a buffet in front of fire.

Auntie ticks me in this night, elddoc.
Entry.124:
F & W

I go down to Station to see auntie off to Douglas. More Brekker. I do all the scullery work & get nicely blacked up. Dinner & I am cook’s offsider. We sit by fire & I wash although I have to stop 2 yards away & I don’t stop. We go inside for music but read & talk a little instead. I slip onto the floor. M. is very tired but we go to meet auntie in the rain. Vivian’s horse has a foal & he does not go to town Elddoc.
Entry.125:
F.

Marie & I go to Douglas by 9 train, morning tea, shopping, dinner & I walk to Granma’s. we get costume, hat, stockings, catch electic train back & I see Ballandane & Mona Lasdy & Snaefell. Auntie Jennie tells fortune. We are very confidential in Laxly train & I hear of years of awful trials of a very lovely girl.
Entry.126:
F.

We all walk over fields up to Gorse patch. I take photos. We sit in cosy room & look at books, etc. I am surprised to be back at old games as in Sydney 6 & Mel. 4 in Egypt. Elddoe & Korse.

Wrote Home, Mr Edmonds, Mr Freemont
Entry.127:
F.

We go up Snaefell much against my will but it is lovely & we have a real good time, we tell stories about one another & have a lovely cycle down hill. Tea near Sulby station. We are very confidential. I help Uncle sew peas & dig garden all morning. I watch uncle at puzzle & won’t sit down.
Entry.128:
F.

Auntie & I beat carpets. Marie & I clean room, polish & pictures. I help hang pictures. I have a 2 year promise of consideration. We are very chummy & speak our minds. S----- is very kind a Sore & hangs my clothes up. We have a little music & read after tea. Elddoe. I go round top road to farm & return same road. It is lovely day.

Nurse.
Entry.129:
F.

I help auntie & then uncle in garden. Recd £10 from Prim. M & I go down to Sulby P.O. around by old Picnic place, we sit on stone by River & I make a pyramid of stones & tell the Tale of Australia & what I intend to do. We come home very tired & one has to be carried upon hips.

Write in Cosy Room to D.J’s & D. Welten
Entry.130:
F.

We sit about all day & look at Books all afternoon. I play Hymns all morning & Auntie sees Septers tail go up. M & I have to rush to stop her talking because the V. has come in quietly.
Entry.131:
F.

We all walk around lane by rush cutter’s place & round one of the hedge again. No good night & I sleep ever sowell & wake up very late, & then, addition to the family – Septer’s foal.

Auntie,
Entry.132:
F.

M & I go to St Johns. Meet Mr Gibson & to Tynwald Hill, tea of Coconut cakes. Cycle to Glen Helen. Go all through Glen & up on Top Bridge, I help M up steps & we walk all sorts of ways & Gippo S – fashion. We cycle one, lovely road with good views of Kirk Michael, Ballayd. Up Ballaugh Glen for tea & back home. Lovely view from tip of glen all over Jurby. Home very sore & we are both dead beat. I say good night early next Door.
Entry.133: We are both dead beat. We eat chocs on landing. Mr G’s door. He is OK again. Afternoon we sit in the study & read poetry & go out into orchard for Photos. We work at puzzle after tea & go to bed at 10 pm. Measure for costume & get souvenir of snap corn cure. I am tucked in again ever so nicely.
Entry.134:
F.

Up at 4.30 am & I declare that I am not awake when called. Say good bye. It is very very bad touching. I arr Doyles’ but should have caught 9 train as boat didn’t leave until 10.30. I walk around to Port Skillion & write letters. Sleep on boat nearly all way. Catch 5.20 train. Dinner on train have good trip & grand meal. Stay at 10 Waterloo Rd. taken there by Y.M.C.A. girl. Fire somewhere near at night but I sleep well.

Wrote M.R.L. (2), Auntie Annie (2), Dad.
Entry.135:
F.

Leave London 6.10 am. Front 11 am. Recd 2 letters from Home. Lottie, Marion Clarke, M.R.L. (2), M Mckinnon. I am very lonely. Meet Billy & go by Y.M.C.A. to write. Go pictures after tea. I have to wangle for bed & get down on hard floor, & go to sleep before the mob gets in. I sleep all night but my neck aches next morning.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.136:
F.

Billy & I walk to Hundcroft in morning & with Reg to village with washing in afternoon. Stay in at night, play cards & write. Go to bed early.

Wrote Dick, Jennie, M.R.L.
Entry.137:
F.

Miss parade & with L/C Dunn after waiting Compton-Chamberlain Cemetery we walk to sarum. It is a lovely walk through beech avenue.i arrive at 11 & go walk with Percy & Mr E. Music & chatters after dinner. Marion is very lively & I have never seen her so price of the devil before. She kisses me while I am packing book for Mell, Dol’s hubby & Harry Marshall "(Ir.2 a.a.c.). W & F come to station with me. I slip through to train & get Home OK with Vic Wright.
Entry.138:
F.

Billy & I carry swag to Dinton & have refreshments there. After dinner we go for sleep etc. after tea get films. Sat & see Picture on "Life of Nelson". 7 reels very good.

2 Boat rolls I miss.

Wrote M.R.L. & Home.
Entry.139:
F.

Print photos all day. Very long job. Go for a walk with Billy after tea, all around Dinton. We view some magnificent views, some magnificent views from ‘Hill Top’. Meet Ted "Ryde", Lyall Walker.

Wrote Lottie, Miss Chapman, Mrs McKinnon
Entry.140:
F.

I just miss fatigue work. Sent photos to MRL. So to Lecture on "Birth of C’wealth" & Boomerang Concert. Constituting began May 9th. Concert rather smutty. Play Billy Billiards on No 4 Crook Table. He beats me by flukes.

Wrote Maureen, C., Ruby Watson. M.R.L.
Entry.141:
F.

I am No 13 in the Section & come out on Boat roll of "Beltana". Need inspection & write letters. Read all afternoon. We go to Torant after tea to get washing. Go to pictures afterwards with Billy.

Wrote Auntie Annie, Dad, Banks to Dad, Mag to M.R.L. & M.R.L.
Entry.142:
F.

QM inspection. Pack bag. Read all afternoon. Concert by "Waratahs" & lecture on "League of Nations" great crush to get in Hall so I get bowled over Kelsey lectures. Concert not extra good.

Wrote M.R.L. Auntie Annie.
Entry.143:
F.

Hop on motor to Sarum. Buy present for MRL. See Nelson Watch, Hope diamond imitation. Go to close on River. Say Good Bye. Return of 1st Wilts. Crowds in Salsibury. Very sad & Concert at night. Can’t sleep in feather bed. Lachry Mose.

Rec’d letter M.R.L. . Stay with Mr Edwards.

Wrote Auntie Annie
Entry.144:
F.

Up at 7. Brekkie, chat, music. I wake at 4 because of motors. Say Good Bye. Percy & Sis come to Wilton. Arrive home O.K. Miss Jacks O.K. Arrive home 3.30. read & lay down until Tea. I am off my tucker, very sad & lonely. Write & go to Post. Meet Cullman & Parry & come home quite cheery. Recd letter Esme. Hawker is found.

Wrote long letter & newest M.R.L.
Entry.145:
F.

I just miss fatigue & give anals party to miss it. I walk down town with Les Nett. He goes away to Glasgow bound for Home. Read most of the day. Go down to with Billy, off my tucker & hear its Luvley when Lovlete we got. Picture & get "Beams". Recd letter from Jennie.

Meet Les Hamil & Craven in Pictures.

Wrote Auntie Annie & M.R.L.
Entry.146:
XX 1695 letters to here XX

F.

Go to Y.M.C.A. & write all morning. Go with Billy in afternoon & play Billiards. He licks me by 25. I sit in hut & write all night & then play Bridge until nearly 11 pm.

Wrote Mum, & letter M.R.L., Esme, Dad, Ellis.
Entry.147:
F.

We are warned to get ready to march out.

Pay Parade. Get £4. Recd 2 letters from Home. I watch B & Ern play Billiards. Win 1 each. I go to Anglo Scotch Concert. It is fine " She’s got to be, if she isn’t & in She’s the loss for me. All the drunks come Home."

Wrote M.R.L (2)
Entry.148:
F.

Recd letter from Dick T. Write all morning. Recd bonnie letter from M.R.L. re present. Play Livo Billiards 113-109. 115-102. Go to Pictures see "The Convict". I go to pictures with my leggings off. I dream that I set out for Home with one Kit bag & no trousers & see M in Indian Turban.

Wrote Mr F, Mr E, M.R.L. (2), Auntie Annie, Jennie.
Entry.149:
F.

I get up & also get Thomas & Jock up. We catch 8 train & 9.45 to London. Meet Dick. Go down Strand, dinner at Aldwych. Go to Australia House. Buy present Auntie Annie in Ludgate Circus. Catch 2.20 Fenchurch St. On boat 3.30 lodge work. Go up town to rotten Theatre. See 4 Girls that I saw at Gcg with Jennie. Supper after too much orchestra. Walk Home. Sleep in Hammock & sleep well. I dream of I of Man & that everyone makes a fuss but one when I am with them.
Entry.150:
F.

Up at 7 am. Write letter go out to town to Post. If a woman says "Good job you’ve got no bloomy hair on your knees or they’d get burnt off". I am on guard over gangway. We sail 12.25 pass Goodwin Sands 8 Bells & Dover at 9.30 pm. I play the piano in V.P. Deck & on Upper deck. Eat large meal very hungry. See a scooter & a muzzled dog.

Wrote M.R.L., Auntie Annie & D.J’s.
Entry.151:
F.

I work in Hospital all day. Go to bed early very tired. Read a little & thought a good deal about my own. Wrote a few lines to Auntie & Marie. We get caught in awful fog but the Pansy puts the Pilot aboard & before tea we we lay off Plymouth Hoe.
Entry.152:
F.

We work very hard. Beds very difficult to make. All troops come aboard after dinner. I meet Dick Coutnay & McLachlan from D.J’s & Burwood. We move our quarters on to a higher deck, it is bon. The numerous war craft in the Harbour would beat any German navy. We see the "Somali: go out.

Wrote Mr F, Mr E, Auntie, Jennie.
Entry.153:
F.

Just catch someone pulling up the gangway to post letters. We put out at 9 am amidst great cheering & band playing "Auld Lang Syne & Rule Britannia". We lay out in stream all day until just 5 pm. I work all day in Ward. Sisters seem to be very good. See Eddystone Lighthouse. King’s Birthday & salutes are fired. See hugh seaplane. Go to bed early pretty tired. We have boat drill but I don’t go on.

Wrote Marie.

1700 letters up till leaving England.
Entry.154:
F.

Lovely day & a little ground swell. We stop to take in Mine-destoyers. We have an inspection like a sea-serpent. Boat drill but I don’t go on. We are very busy upstairs. I come downstairs very tired & go straight to bed.
Entry.155:
F.

Sea choppy but we make good headway with sea behind us. Pass 2 ships about 10 am, my afternoon off. I go below to read & write. I develop awful headache & nothing will relieve it so I go to bed all afternoon & evening.
Entry.156:
F.

I go upstairs to wash & have bit. I am so weak will that I cannot do anything. I sit in chair for a couple of hours. Then come below & lie about till dinner time. No brekkie or dinner, not even a drink until 5 pm, go to bed after dinner. Better at Tea & eat a little. Headache worst in my life. Meet Jack Craven. See schools of porpoises & whales.
Entry.157:
F.

Lovely Day. We see some ships but in the distance. I rub the C.O’s arm. Work all day, am booked for the voyage as Nurse. We have music in afternoon. Sea calm but nice breeze in afternoon. I have a chase over a deck chair. I am much better to-day. I go to the nether regions for ice.
Entry.158:
F.

We pass the Canaries about 3 am & I just see one island about 6 am. A nice howling quarter breeze & nice steady roll helping the ship slong.

I work hard all day & get a haircut which takes nearly an hour. I feel very I.O.W. sick on viewing Teneriffe all songs make me think. We have an extraordinary tea of fruit cake etc.
Entry.159:
F.

Very busy all day. Go to hi tea 2 class. A lot of teeth get scattered about. Fair swell all night & this morning. I was very cool all night. I eat all sorts of rubbish all day long. Jack Craven comes up for a couple of hours. This marks the first milestone in a 2 year journey.

Wrote M.R.L.
Entry.160:
F. Very Hot

We sight land after dinner. 2 big white houses on cliff, a L. House & a wreck. 4 niggers in a boat about 12 or 14 miles out. I go to French class & talk everyone out. Jack Craven comes up after tea & we talk etc. we sleep on boat deck. We pass a steamer Home to about 9.30, ¼ mile away. Sight ships lights on starboard horizon. Sleep well but I tie myself on with a rope.

Post No 1 Diary to Auntie.
Entry.161:
F & Hot

Baths erected & a ducking starts. Several casualties 3 in hospital. I miss class over it. An uproar & horse play all afternoon. I go on top deck with Jack at 8 pm. We sleep until 2 am & lightning & rain sends us down below. We sleep in Hospital. Dream I am back in I of Man & Auntie has all things put in different places. Uncle plays sounds & there is a boy & Girl that I buy sweets for.
Entry.162:
Wet & Hot

Fine after breakfast. Very strong wind a bit choppy. I read after dinner outside starboard Port holes but have to come inside it is so cool. Use last of scented soap. Read & write after 8 pm. Go up aloft to sleep & have nice cool wind. Have very good meals. Pork, Vermi & Har Beans, Sago & Peaches. See flying fish again.
Entry.163:
F Cool Wind

Work hard in morn & go to Book-keeping in afternoon. Partnership makes me very puzzled. I am very forgetful & do strange things. Jack & I sit up reading until late. We cross the line but it is a lovely cool day with a strong wind. I dream that this is in Aussie going about everywhere. We cross the line. I sleep on seat in Hosp.
Entry.164:
F.

We crossed the line last night or early this morning. I go on Boat deck with Jack for afternoon tea. I see a shark & lots of flying fish. I try to do some book-keeping but all the mob on the arell deck singing the songs shown on the screen put me off altogether. So I read instead.

Wrote M 2
Entry.165:
F.

Lovely day. Church parade & we sit on balcony. Hear story of 2 frogs in a bucket of milk. Comforts issued. Socks, Treacle, Biscuits, Cigs etc. watch rather pretty sunset. I am all dressed up & nowhere to go.

Very cool day, strong head wind & a little swell. Sleep up aloft.

Wrote M 3.
Entry.166:
F & lovely cool day, fair swell.

I give up Hospital duty. Take English lecture & read all afternoon. I go up on Duty for 2 hours to lelieve. A chap gets 106. What a fuss! I read & Jack & I play German whist all night. I also play Patience but cheat like m--------. I see M est grande on French Blackboard.
Entry.167:
F.

No duties. I go on deck to study, come down below to study. Boat has heavy list to port. She rocks surprisingly for such calm weather.

Partnerships again all afternoon. I do no bon neither do the others. Jack puggarees my hat. Our Boys win the special prize for cleanliness. Another boat drill. I larrickinise with no boats.

Wrote M 4 X Wait for reply X
Entry.168:
F.

We go round in circles morning & evening. We get paid & I have plenty of feloos. I read & study all morning. Read sleep & fritter around all afternoon. We have Tea from cherries etc. comforts fund gift. I dream of sunshine mound 1 pram. M.I & B. Brian M. married waiting at Power House on the little boarded grating also home pony & trap & she comes to L meforit likener the hat.
Entry.169:
F.

Go to English lesson in morning, read & write all afternoon. We have a lecture on Morocco which is tres bob. Incident of Native Harem. Read all night. Go to bed early.

Dream of all washing on line in this boat. I help Auntie M to make tea. Dream of Burwood also & T Clarke.

Wrote M. 5
Entry.170:
F.

English lesson in morning. I read all day. We have Book-keeping in afternoon. I get the problem right but no one else. I read all day & night & go to bed early. All the plates slide down the table. It is impossible to enjoy a meal.
Entry.171:
F.

The boat gets a horrible list to port. I get pushed from pillar to post & do nothing all morning. Jack & I play cards on deck. I write all afternoon & night others read a little. Lights go out & boys sing. We have preserved ginger for Tea. We roll about a lot. Watch lovely sunset.

Wrote Granma, Jessie, Mr F, Mr Edmonds, Dick, Book No 2 to Auntie. M 6.
Entry.172:
F.

We sight land early but do not arrive in port until 5.30 pm. At 6.30 pm lots have already gone ashore the chaps off Rio Padro putting up a gangway. I go ashore with Win & Nick. We dine at a lounge mego on Pier & all around town I meet fitz Hill. We eat lots of fruit & we have pains next day. Gell cab Erino Hagh.

Wrote M 7.
Entry.173:
F.

WROTE to Auntie & M.

I go up town & try to get Books etc, have tea at A Lounge. Ride up to town in motor. I jump into cab Bonnie Dundee & arrive at boat just in time to catch motor party. We go to Cardonia Hotel for dinner & then out to Hout Bay. I return & go to Mrs Lidbury (Sister of Mrs Murray, Bondi Junct.) for Tea. There are five girls. We have music & dancing. We all go down Town to see whether a peace is signed. H.A.D. back to supper other Town & walk Home.
Entry.174:
F.

Kloof St. Sent Boa & Feather to Aunt.

Jack, Art, Cliff & I go to Soldiers Welcome & Anzac Lounge also buy P.C’s etc at Tukney’s in Dock road. We have morning tea at A.L. & Mrs Norton takes 4 of us out to Observatory in train. We have tea again & lovely dinner. Go to C. Rhodes Home & then to this monument cost £80,000. I am very tired in agony with tooth ache, we see menagerie & wild native beasts. Back to gardens. Dinner & music meet Dr Wood (Gavin works there) Supper & Photos shown. Tram & motor back to ship.

WROTE Auntie 2 & M 8
Entry.175:
F.

I write to M.R.L. & J.C. throws letter in water. I write another & give to wharfinger to post. A boat comes in with 1000 fritz’s on board. We operate all morning. I am in awful agony with tooth & dentist pulls it out for me. I gain instant relief & I go to bed all afternoon & again at 7 pm. We have pudding, lollies & fruit for tea. We sail at 2 pm & I see the last of the pinnacle about 5 pm.

Wrote M.R.L. 9
Entry.176:
F.

I begain work again in earnest & the boat’s rolling makes me & my tried before I am finished my work. Work all afternoon. I go to Poetry lesson. Tell Sister to go to B & get on B-------. I try to write to Auntie but I am none too bright so I write 3 pages & get off to bed in Hospital on seat.
Entry.177:
W.

I watch a gale blowing up. We get it very windy but choppy & swell very slight. I get very tired hopping about all the same. I go to Book Keeping but Branch accounts are tricky.

Gale blowing worse. I go to bed in top bunk in Hosp.
Entry.178:
W.

Awful gale raging. I get up & do an hour’s work. Lie down behind screen on seat all day. Dinner & tea but I refuse pork. I read about mysteries of Marseilles. Go to bed after an hour’s work at Tea time.
Entry.179:
F.

Lovely day. Cool. Gale ceased but huge swell. Breakages galore. I feel more safe & work all the time. I write & read Milton. Go to bed at 9 pm.
Entry.180:
F.

Finish my Cape Town Story. Go to English class on Figures of speech. Sea much calmer & lots of small birds about. I go in sweep on mileage but lose horribly. I play my game of Cribbage & win. Work right up till 8 pm bath, write & go to bed. It was cold & rainy & I had to get up at 3 am to close Port Hole.

Wrote M 10.
Entry.181:
F.

Major has liver & makes all the others buzz around. Go to Boo-Keeping. Sleep downstairs on the floor. I go in Crib Tourney & miss first round we fasten Ports as Gale is expected. We are warned to parade come on deferred pay.

Sit in Oper Theatre & read M’s letters. I am very much overcome.
Entry.182:
W.

Gale raging. I mess around all morning. Go to Book-Keeping in afternoon. Play draughts before going on Duty. We develop films in pantry after pm.

Go to bed on seat & pack myself in like a parcel about midnight. Arise at 6 am & have K bustle. Music makes me very thoughtful about my chere solin. Lecture on deciduous fruits.
Entry.183:
I am outed at 3rd round of Crib Tourney.

F.

A gale blowing & sea is very angry. I nearly go without brekkie but I am too hungry.

Shave & can’t find a place to work. I go to English lesson on greatness of English Language. Walk on promenade with Jack Craven. Go to bed in hammock. Big swell on boat rolling fiercely. Write & read & go to bed next to table at 11 pm.
Entry.184:
F,

Feeling very onkers until Tea-time. Pushed about all morning. Cadge at trousers for packs. No Book-keeping. Listen to lecture on Light Horse to Gaza. Play Bridge Tourney. 
Win
. Go up starirs early. Cadge Trous, have supper. Wash tops in bath. Turn in about minuint.

Sea fairly smooth.
Entry.185:
F.

I am very annoyed at being hunted from one place to another. Lecture on Pruning after dinner. Go up to Hosp after tea. Speak to Sister Roberts about Salonica & Hilda K. awful tale of malaria, wasted lives of beautiful young nurses. We have music from Gramophone. We have a case of Hysteria – He sees things, look at em out there, when He looks at me. Heavy rolling of ship, I sleep next yellow jaundice but only get about 1 hour. Dream I am with Ellis on Lille, Rouen road.

6 July, Sunday

F.

We are unarmed to make secure as the Baron is falling & it is already too rocky to move about. I get sleep under rack. All go to bed after dinner. I am greeted by "Come to me Sweet Marie" as I go on duty & read about H & M.

 I lie awake all night with sick chap. Majot talks to me in bed. I have had no sleep since 2 am on
Entry.186:
C deck is flooded out by sea. Swim about down below.

Wrote M 11, dishes are bewitched.
Entry.187:
W & F

Lovely night – moonlight. Heavy swell, cold miserable morning. Go to English on What is Poetry. Go to hammock after dinner. Too cold to sleep come up stairs straight after tea, write to M in a quatrain about my pretty one. I feel as if I must write like it feels. Go to bed at 11 pm sleep bonz. I see all frosted lights in morning Els had no sleep for 60 hours. Lovely moonlight night.
Entry.188:
F

First fine day & calm sea since Capetown. Play Bridge Tourney & fail Lecture on Light Horse in Palestine. I go up to bed early & read about Hallainds rise as a literary man. I go to Sister’s cabin & nurse her. She looks OK in Pink . I go to bed afterward & sleep well. I contract sneezing about of a cold.
Entry.189:
2nd M.S.

F.

I go on Deck & read for sometime. Go to bed after dinner but too cold to sleep. I listen to lecture on & pests of fruit while in my hammock. We are again warned about a storm. A debate on Japan & Australia. I go to hospital & write until after lights out.

Wrote to M 12
Entry.190:
F.

Lovely sunny day. I spend most of the day in the sun. Talk with Jack & Browny from Bondi. I have n. catarrh & sore throat. Very calm sea. Last of Comforts issued. Got to Concert. Go upstairs & listen to Gramophone. Go to bed early on floor. We are again warned about approaching storm.
Entry.191:
F.

Very rough sea & strong gale. Sea roughest yet. Jack Cramer gets a WAC Conigrams. I I read about H & M become separated though married & return to one another. Read.

Mar. wom. 28 falls 1 & L with single M of 04. Reads .

Read a Bachelors love Story Collects. Single girl 82 m. grey haired bandman of 04 go to bed in hammock. Just as well as there is another flood. Distribution on music & wardrobe.
Entry.192:
F.

Spend whole day reading. Lectures on Fruit pests & to Jerusalem, Allenby means "Bearer of the Law".

Description of Kaiser & Allenby’s entrances to Jerusalem the blessed. Read at night. Awful list on boat & swell still troublesome. I am hungry but can’t eat ships munfaces. We have another kit inspection for dutiable goods.
Entry.193:
F. Rainbows & rain storms all around the ship.

I read an Author’s Daughter in the morning. I write & read all afternoon but I am in a very lonely mood. I go to Lecture on the early History of the Phillistines in Segts mess with Jack Cramer at night. Come down afterwards & write before I go to bed. I have a great test of will & win.

Medical Inspection for Throats & Chests.

Wrote M 13.
Entry.194:
F.

Lovely morning. Rain for a time. I watch tug o’ war. Try to print Photos. Write after dinner & listen to Lecture on Jerusalem. We sight land as I’m writing to Auntie Annie at 4.30 pm. Boys are very excited. I make a good tea but get very thirsty afterwards. I play cards until Debate on State V private ownership. I go out & pinch mungaree, & eat & promenade. Go to bed 9.30 pm.

Wrote Jennie, Mr F. Mr E., Auntie Annie, Gran Nicholls, Dad, Mum, George.
Entry.195:
F.

We lay at anchor all night & we are up & breakfast by 6.45 am. I am detailed to take Temps of all the men. It is a farce. We pull in to shore about 10 am. Great crowds & I am very pull up. We go ashore at noon but no train until 2 pm. I refuse dinner. We arrive Adelaide 2.45 pm. I look for Queen’s Mall but get lost & then found. Lovely Church then I post Book No 4 views to M. I catch Malrene Tram & can’t find No 65. I have dinner & arrive back in Town at 7.30 catch 8.30 train & write to M when I get Home but don’t finish letter.
Entry.196:
F.

Dull & cold. I work all day alone. We have a lot of work. V.A.D’s from the shore come aboard. I run ashore for an hour for dinner. I help myself in the Y.M.C.A. Work all afternoon & go ashore at 8 pm to Concert Hall. I hear first song "Someday you’ll know how much I love you. You’ll be sorry you sent me away". I play for Highland Fling twice. We can’t sail because we have such a terrible list to starboard.

Wrote M 14.
Entry.197:
F. 

Lovely Day. We sail at 6 am. We have a big clearance in Hospital. I expect to go overland from Melbourne so I pack all my bags & bring ‘em up to Hospital.
Entry.198:
We get news at 3 pm that we go ashore at Melbourne & overland. All excited & tons of work. I sleep in Hospital on top story. 

We sight the heads at 8 pm.
Entry.199:
We are up early but I stop on boat clearing away & nearly miss train. I get in with Frank Henessey & others. We have a mean hungry trip to Albury. Arr Albury 8.10, Supper & away on sleeping ambulance train at 8.40. all town with band at Wagga. I know nothing from Coota- to Goulbutn. Lovely beds. Melbourne dead & we don’t get a kind smile.

M 15
Entry.200: I meet Reg Binan at Strathfield & Nette, Bessie, Laura, Mrs Mel, Dad, Mum, George, Ellis, Lil & Etta. Catch 12 boat Home & I am only one to get cock-a-doodle-do. Motor Home. Dinner. Tea Otto & Amy come. Wal & Ida, Mrs P, Miss Pogson, Mrs Doyle. I see various parties. Home I am not excited but very dull. First song is "Parted".
Entry.201: We go to Town. Dinner. Mum goes to Julie & I go to Anzac Buffet. I meet at Julies. We pull down decorations. I meet Doris & ring Mary.
Entry.202:
Stop Home. We visit Dobbies & Mrs Stephen & White’s place. I r------

Wrote M 16
Entry.203:
I go to town. Dinner with E. Go for walk with Tony. To H’cut & shave. See Frosty. Pa & Otto & Teck. D.J’s to P.S. Board & Home with Polly Bruce. We all sit & talk.

Buy Australian Native life. I visit Chris.
Entry.204: I practice Trousers & Vests. Catch 12.45 boat. Go to Bank. Ellis, Tony, Verey’s. Public Service Board, Anzac Buffet, Cock’s, D.J’s, Home. I ring Sally Nin. Clothes come, home also Hat. Met Major Clay.
Entry.205:
Go to Town, meet Os Young, Dave Vernon, Frank Falls. Buy boots. First time in Civvies. Go to Pictures with Dave. Buy fruit & peanuts. Go out to Glebee. Come Home with Bert Cocks. Go to Manly with Mum about Brook. See Ray o’Grady’s people.

Received several letters that I wrote in England.
Entry.206:
Recd Discharge & medal. I do gardening & clean up yard & act as executioner of the Ducks. Look out old books & photos.

Ring Mary & Mrs Hoper 529K or to apply my job. I go to Dobbers, forget shirt, get dressed in dark mum’s overcoat & forget mungaree. Play cards & win easily.
Entry.207:
Drive to Dee Why. Go walk on hill. Duck for dinner. George to Marathon at Long Reef. Cold & windy.

I look out all letters & P.C’s & we sort them up & sit to talk after tea.

Wrote Auntie Annie
Entry.208: Mum & I go out in rain to H’ville, meet Dick’s people & then go to Nelsons. Arrive Home at 9 pm.
Entry.209:
Mum & I go to Granma’s & Aunt Fannies. Shopping at Grace Bros & to pictures & to Glebe.

Break up in general. We all strike same boat Home. Meet O.G.H.M. We all race to bed in screams of silent laughter. 

Send love & painting of Kookaburra .
Entry.210:
I go to Burwood. Watch tennis at old Cernt & the Davey Boys. Meet Brigg’s & Mrs Haigh. I have a very good time & sleep out on verandah. We write to Jessie.

Wrote M 17. Wrote Jessie.
Entry.211:
Meet H Deigre.

Catch 9.30 to Rockdale. M & I got to get M’s skirt. It is a failure & we take it back. We have a very nice time. See Winnie at night. I introduce W. to Mrs Nelson. I go to Cuneo’s & meet Ida Mul. We talk so we sit on the mat until 1 am. I sleep in dining room.
Entry.212:
I catch 8.50 with Laura. Go shopping. Meet Dave. Visit Dulcie. Meet Roy & Jack. Go to Charlie Jones & Marlborough St. We play snooker & I win well. We meet Massie.

I go Home very tired. Knocked out.
Entry.213: George & I drive around Manly, visit Marg & see Mrs Taubman. All family Home to tea. Also Nette.
Entry.214: Nette & I go to Otto’s. We go up on Hill to see aboriginal carvings. Gramaphone Music after tea. I get warm before I go to bed.
Entry.215:
Nette, Mum & I go shopping, Millinery etc. I am very dopey & feel off colour, meet Charlie Pearson.

I am very cranky.

Wrote Miss Dickson, Mrs Bell & organist.
Entry.216: We catch 7.45 boat. Meet Jim Gosper, Mabel, H Belle, Nick. See lots of others. We go to Windsor. Good trip. Nice day. See boys & go on river banks for walk. Have a good day. Arrive Home 11.30 pm.
Entry.217:
Stop Home. Gardening & House maid. Ring Nette, Mrs Clarke. Speak Nette 35 minutes or more. Sandy nearly eats a child.

Do a few hours gardening & read & write at night.

Receive notification about deferred pay.
Entry.218:
Mum & I sort out trophies & boxes, clothes, etc nearly all day. Ring Mrs Clarke. Write at night.

Wrote Auntie Annie.
Entry.219:
Mum & I drive to Manly & do a lot of shopping, meet Percy Hickson & Amy.

We drive to Dee Why. I play piano all night & amuse Dad & Mum. Ellis & George out. Recd April letters back from Eng & France.

Wrote to M.R.L. 18
Entry.220:
Doris Park brings in music "Till we meet". We chop the tree down & I work like a nigger. I wash & go to Otto’s place for Tra & Talk.

Recd invitation to Party on
Entry.221:
10 August, Sunday

Chop wood in morning. Geo & I go to Narrabeen see Livo. Come Home & stay. Moonlight & I think of Island. I play piano until Dad & Mum go to bed. Mum is melancholy. 

M 19
Entry.222:
Mum & I go to Manly shopping. Visit Mrs Stephen, Dobbies & Whiteheads & Creightons. We buy Ellis’s presents & soda syphon.

Wrote to Mr Paul.
Entry.223:
Stop Home in garden all day.

Wrote M 20
Entry.224:
Stop Home in garden all day.

Wrote M 21
Entry.225: I go to Town to repat. To Otto. Meet May Nil. Catch 5 boat Home. Nasty windy day & I can’t do without a chin strap. Meet Wally Badginlov & Bert Coffins.
Entry.226: I catch 9.45 boat. 2 ½ Hrs at Repat. I order Goods. Buy suit length. George drives me to Q.V.B. I get Civi suit. See about Warrant, meet Basil Gordon. Meet Jim Wilkins on 4.40 boat. Take Gear to Otto’s place.
Entry.227: Ellis is married. Breakfast at Paddington Town Hall. 9 pm boat Home. Meet Mrs Royle. A grand day.
Entry.228: Stop Home in garden all day. I go to Dobboe’s to Tea at night & Chris & I again win at 500.
Entry.229: I go to work. Everything is very strange but I get on passably well. I go to Dobboes & help fix the rooms etc but there is more talk than work.
Entry.231: Catch 10 pm boat & do not feel as tired as expected.
Entry.232:
Elizabeth Dee Why at 7.30 pm.

Work in garden all afternoon. Go to Manly with M Paul & ring Mrs Preddy. Meet two Miss Thomas’. Go to evening. Meet nice people. Play. Meet George ventriloquist. Come home with Mrs Moran, only two in tram. Meet Mr Wiltshire.
Entry.233: O go out to Cock’s for dinner & tea. We go looking for land at North Harbour & rate several new houses. Cocky that sneezes. I go on South Steyne beach for first time music & chatter all the time.
Entry.234: Painter at shop & is a nuisance. Meet Les Merrett & go Home.
Entry.235: Dave’s Place. We walk to P’sham & I go to Trukdale but all are out. I catch 10 pm boat, meet Norrie Dempsey.
Entry.236: Go to Bexley. Meet Clare. I just catch last boat. Go up to Darley Rd in Motor with ‘am Bone & arrive Home at 1 am.
Entry.237:
I write to M at work. I am very thoughtful.

Wrote M 22.
Entry.238: Call for Daphne Plants. I have to do all manner of work, try-ons etc. Pa, Otto & I have a great yarn on the 10 pm boat.
Entry.239:
I stay Home at night but Dad, Bess & I drive to Dee Why in afternoon & go walk on beach. We do not notice that the House has been moved.

I am very tired & Bess is not well. Dad, George, Mum & Lily go to theatre.
Entry.240: Bess is down. I potter in garden all morning. We go gathering wild-flowers in the afternoon. E & E come out for tea.
Entry.241:
Engaged at Walter Watrons.

We have a nice time & music. I miss train but arrive at Tiksdale in time for telling of fortune.
Entry.242: Go to Town with B & Hanna. I go Home to House of Girl. I nearly knock down on the wharf with Ellis & Etta. We go to flat & lay linos. Terrific thunderstorms & a water sprout off the Heads.
Entry.243:
Very quiet day. Dad goes to Doctor. Rec’d P.C. from H. Hey & Card & Tie from E & E. 

M 23
Entry.244: Sent off Kookaburra bag to M bought at Marcus Clark’s.
Entry.245: Terrific rain storms. I buy fruit etc & have a terrible job getting it Home.
Entry.246: Dinner in Manly. No 13 ticket & 1/3. Dis-app over marathon. Go Home, back to Dobboes to Ellis place & to Britt Theatre for Fisk Jubilee Singers with Gen, Lil & Mum. Great rain up till 11 pm & then glorious day.
Entry.247:
Spend Day at Dee Why cleaning etc. cook dinner in open. Come Home, chop wood & write at night. Too much energy which I work off.

Dream of H Hickson.

Wrote M 24 & H. Hey.
Entry.248: Felling fittest yet, very cold day. Go for moonlight walk to tram, bail up several for pennies to get home. All in bed at Pet 1601.
Entry.249: Go to see Charlie in take Bess & Laura. Very rainy day. Stay at Stanmore meet Horrie Norton.
Entry.250:
Go to North Steyne. Welcome in Tyke’s Hall.

Meet lots but not Peg. Sit with G. H. Taubman & Mrs T. Dance with a nice ma-in-law.
Entry.251: Go Home to cut out suit. Ellis & Ette out to tea. I have lost measures & go to bed instead.
Entry.252: Work all day & I have a rush at night where People are lined two-deep. Go down & see Doris & buy coat see Ellis Roy & Wal at dinnertime.
Entry.253:
Dinner at Esplanade Café. Go to Sports which are great. Aeroplane & motor stunts. Go to Ellis’ with crowd for Tea & meet Billy. Meet Amy Bert & Myra Brown. Go to Pictures see "Woman".

Recd letter from Lodge & Doris.
Entry.254:
Go to Dee Why. Fix Linos & clean up outside. An awful windy day & it is a terrible drive Home. Sit & talk after chopping wood & cleaning up etc. Go to bed after a bath.

Wrote Doris.
Entry.255:
Bread strike begins so procession march along George St. I talk outside shop with sympathiser. I nearly buy a fight on tram Home.

Write to Ida Dunn.
Entry.256: Go to Welcome Home. Awful pianist, awful songs. "The Irish Washerwoman" nearly kills me & brings me out in a sweat. I respond & play Auld Lang Syne. Meet Tom Proud.
Entry.257: Play piano & talk until bed time.
Entry.258:
Very tired go to bed at 8.30 pm.

Recd letter from H Hey.
Entry.259: Work late. Go to visit Julie but no luck.
Entry.260:
Feeling best ever. Cut grass & dig in garden. Go to theatre with Mum. Very good although I nearly fight with Brooky mob.

Go Dobbees first.
Entry.261: Very dopey. Think I have got Jo. Pick peas. Go to Manly to Ellis’ place. Meet Dave & Doris also Jeffes from 39 Gen. Catch 8 pm tram Home. Take Argyrol Treatment.
Entry.262:
Go for treatment twice. Go to Inksdale via P’sham. No Tea. Go for stroll. Laura & I sit & talk also Bess.

Write Queenie.
Entry.263:
Twice for treatment. Speak to N only.

Wrote M 25
Entry.264: Go to Dobboes to play cards. We lose 2 & win two. I get Home by 10.35 pm. I am very tired but spend a pleasant evening.
Entry.266: Recd letter from YMCA RDT & Connie. Work late. I but Crepant & Tomato plant & get name of House.
Entry.267:
Miss boat by seconds. We start to paint. I go in for a swim & the cold nearly freezes me but lovely afterwards. Terrific hot day & we all sleep out. M & I on floor & we get no sleep. Until southerly at minuit.

Recd letters from Dot & Ida.
Entry.268: I am tres malade. We paint House. Pony goes mad wants to sit down. Mum is scared. E & Pad drive Home & we come Home by tram. I with Sandy in the back. Ring Doris, feeling lonely. Go to bed at 6.30 pm.
Entry.269: Go to meet Doris & Maisie. Wait 35 minutes. Have no Tea. We go to theatre. See unfrequented love of Japanee boy who dies looking after child of his lost love. See Annette Kellerman in Queen of the Sea. Just catch 10 pm boat.
Entry.270:
Further treatment met George Fernif. See N but I have to leave my seat for an autie Digger on boat. Music for Dad & Mum & write letters.

M 26
Entry.271: Jack & Rory come home to Tea. Singing & music. Jack stays all night & I sleep indoors.
Entry.272: Catch 7.45 boat. Feel funny all day. Mum lets me lie in ‘cos I look so comfy & I have 30 minutes to dress & all. Ring Mrs Harper & Doris. Catch 7 pm boat. Miss Jack & Roy. Meet Ted Mel. Cold & wet. I walk up & down outside Home & go in at 8.15. Jack comes at 9. I undertable. Hear Girl & Jack say funny things.
Entry.273:
Go down markets shopping.

Recd letter from Auntie & Marie last night. I read them before going to bed.
Entry.274:
Meet Ray Clarke. Trams crowded E & I try to catch horse but fail. Mum & I go to Taubs. Meet Nellie.

Go to Ottos’s for plants. Ida & Nat come down & kids. I take ‘em all paddling in creek. Gee they get in a mess. I dig & plant all day.

Wrote Auntie Annie.
Entry.276: & plant all morning. We go to Dee Why in afternoon. Meet Geo Lil & Myrtle. I am very quiet. I am better after & watering my garden. Amuse Dad & Mum until nearly 9 pm.
Entry.277: Pretty tired after Holiday. I begin letter to M.
Entry.278: Got to Hurstville. We chat & regard photos until late. I arrive at B.C’s at 10.30 pm & B gets out to Supper.
Entry.279: Jack & I go up to the Hospital & meet Doris.
Entry.281: Dad & I dine at B. Go to Ida’s place. Bert gives us some Yiddisher. We get Home at 10 pm. Are upset by drunks on boat.
Entry.282:
I go to N. Steyne for 2 dips. It is lovely & I get very sunburnt. Go to Manly afternoon. Swim again. Dine with E & E. Home at 7.30 pm.

Wrote all night.
Entry.283:
Edie T comes in & I get an awful shock & puts me off my work all day.

Dad G & I fix bath.

Wrote M 27
Entry.284: Recd letter from Nette. George & I print Photos. No bon.
Entry.285: Disap. Go to Dobboes. Play 5 handed 500. Home at 10 pm.
Entry.286: I dine at B with Ot. We go to T’s in Kang St. I talk all night. Meet Him. Home at 11 pm.
Entry.287: We are fearfully busy & take 28. Meet E & E on boat. I am Hooker in meet W.H.A.
Entry.288:
Go to D Why. Fix door & layout the ashes. I go for a swim alone & then for a stroll to then rocks. We have dinner at Guys & Tea on the beach. Two talking women drive me nearly mad, come Home at 7 pm & write & play piano.

Wrote Kev, Pine & H Hey & E & K Naple.
Entry.289: Catch 9.15 boat with Otto & Amy. Go to beach with N in afternoon. We go to Melville at night, arrive Home minuit. Up at daybreak almost because of roosters etc, next morning.
Entry.290: Meet Dave’s Girl in tram. Get in the wrong train too. Home again & early to bed.
Entry.291: Otto’s place for tea & cards. Meet Bob Brown nearly kiss wife & carry supper in my hands.
Entry.292:
Home wrote to Connie. Dinner with Roy. Go to uni with Jesse. Recd letter from Jack.

Wrote Con.
Entry.293:
Ellis & Etta to tea. We play whist. Dinner with Roy. Roy comes Home to sleep. Much argument at Home. Recd letter from Doris & Staples.

Wrote Auntie Annie.
Entry.294:
Frightful busy day. I cut 10 suits by 5 pm & Otto 23. Dick comes Home but I can’t go up to see Him.

Dad moves His possie. He sleeps so well that He does not hear S & I come in (because we don’t come Home at all). Dick & I go to Zoo & Bot. Gardens. Meet Harry & Mrs Hey. I go to P’s with two Nurses after meeting Mr Lord in Macquarie St. I play piano until Girls go to sleep.
Entry.295: Have stayed at P’s. Get up awaked by Jackass & Kid. Go walk Brekkie etc. 45 minutes along the Forest Rd, sweet smelling rose to Beulah. Dinner & catch 2.30. I come Home to bed. Mum & I go to Ellis’ place after tea. Go down to Band. Last tram Home.
Entry.296:
Not too bright. Meet Rup Beale wife & Les Merrett. Motor Home. Walk from Depot 20 minutes.

Write Cards to M. Mr F & Mr E. recd letter & film from Dave Lord.

D.I.C.M. & S.L.I.

Letter to A. Annie, D Webster & H Rayner & Jennie.
Entry.297:
Play whist & Bridge & write.

Wrote Marie 28.
Entry.299:
Ellis & Etta at Home. We play Bridge.

Someone calls to see me (Eady) I have take at house & the night Girl. We are fixing the rooms.
Entry.300: O & I look at Rexanola. Roy comes in on way to Melbourne. Very busy night.
Entry.301: Garden all afternoon. We all go to Daddy Long Legs at night. This very good. I meet Mrs Merrett.
Entry.302:
I go to N Steyne in morning. Surf rotten. Go to Dobboe’s Baths after dinner & hand. Meet Bert C & Lady from W.A. E & E for tea. Home & write at 8 Mr Tran. Meet Ted Collis & wife & family. Plant Dahlias & do weeding.

Wrote M 29
Entry.303:
Go to B Cuneos. Mrs C away. We have music & chatter until bed time.

Sent mail & P.C. of wild flowers & ocean beach pamphlet.
Entry.304: Home & play cards until nearly 10 pm.
Entry.305: We go to Town Hall, only half full. Good show. Good speeches. I stop Mum running for boat. Meet Mrs Bissett & Ma Whaison.
Entry.306:
E & E out to tea. We play Bridge. Meet Mr Smith on boat. Recd letter from M Smith.

Wrote M Smith.
Entry.307: I feel very tired after dinner we have a puffent lady in the shop. I go down markets note the Circus.
Entry.308: Go to M. No Din, sit on perch on promenade. Sports. I save O King. Go to E. Furniture Home. Down Corso. Lights, fireworks, confetti. Meet Dorrie, Roch, Ray, Alty & Mamie & Nancy. Sit on beach & along Corso. Home at 11 pm. Meet Errol Lovell & Scottish band & Nurse Lascelles. Recd letters from R Pine & M at Carnival.
Entry.309: Gardening all morning. Dad & I go to Dee Why. Lovely in water but sharky. Snake in grass at Dee Why. Ellan Van. Music after Tea, a lovely southerly at 8 pm.
Entry.310:
Go up on boat with pel & Lighthouse. Come Home. Played cards with Dad till 9 pm & wrote to M. Mum comes into the Shop. Sent paper (Smith’s) & almanac to Auntie.

Wrote M 30
Entry.311: Recd letter from Auntie & Card of wedding from Marion. Go to Smiths & meet lots who know me. Tea at Railway with O & B. act guide to Smiths. Nice evening. Played the empty stockin’ game.
Entry.312:
Go back to Manly. Meet Billy & others.

Glad to get Home by after 10 tram.
Entry.313:
Come Home & play cards.

Very wet.
Entry.315:
Dinner at Esp Café. Tea with Muriel & Eunice. Watch sports in Bay & go down Corso at night. Meet Stan, Bruce, Dobboes, Sherriffs & Bat Cocks.

Play Billiards at M’s place.

Hear about Percy farming.
Entry.316:
Dig & make wall around top garden. Go to Dee Why & fix ashes on front of house. Swim & Home again. E & E out to dinner.

Wrote Auntie Annie.
Entry.317: Go to E & E for Tea & meet N at 8 pm. Meet R Charles & go walk along Lovers Walk to Condamine St.
Entry.318: Nettie comes down. We miss tram but go to M & meet G & Possie. We go in show on beach & laugh though specialley at possie. Catch 11.50 tram Home.
Entry.319: Come Home & go to bed early. Dad’s seems very very bad.
Entry.320: E & E come out & we play cards all night. Renfrey knocks my arm & I look for damages in doorway.
Entry.321: Work & Work. Go to Jumble Sale but find no one.
Entry.322: Meet Roy. I look for stakes but heat & flies worry me. Dig my own old garden specially sort out bulbs. Roy for Tea & Mr & Mrs Johnson. Roy & I go to N. S. but do not swim. Play snooker. Go to Smiths down road. Confetti fights all night meet lots of old pals.
Entry.323: Look for stakes again. Go to Manly after dinner. Mooch around band. Meet N. Dempsey & the violinist. Go for swim & up to E & E. Meet Dave Williams. E & E out go to Muriel’s place meet Edie & uncle. play billiards & buy hat. Dream that M is going to Australia & I say Good Bye in England.
Entry.324: Go to Stanmore. We have a jovial time & go to bed really late.
Entry.325: Come Home & ill so to bed early.
Entry.326: Jack fails to ring Nette but I go out. We go on beach for a walk & eat peaches & cherries.
Entry.327:
Come Home & play Cards. Dad & I badly defeat George & Ellis.

Wrote to Auntie Annie.
Entry.328: We buy more films. Very busy all day O & I are real ill.
